title: Pandemic cut Nepal life expectancy by three years - The Kathmandu Post
description: Pandemic cut Nepal life expectancy by three years  The Kathmandu Post
publisher.title: The Kathmandu Post
full_article:
The Covid-19 pandemic reduced the average life expectancy of Nepali people by nearly three years between 2019 and 2021, a report published by The Lancet, a leading international medical journal, shows.

The decline is almost double the global average, which is 1.6 years, according to the report.

Nepal’s life expectancy at birth increased by six years from 2000 to 2021—65.3 years in 2000 to 71.3 in 2020—according to the World Health Organisation.

However, the report, titled “Global age-sex-specific mortality, life expectancy, and population estimates in 204 countries and territories and 811 subnational locations, 1950-2021, and the impact of the Covid-19 pandemic: a comprehensive demographic analysis for the Global Burden of Disease Study 2021” published last month shows that average life expectancy of Nepali people stood at 68.4 years for both sexes—70.8 years for females and 66.1 years for males in 2021.

“This is a severe blow to the progress we made over the years through great effort and billions in investments,” said Dr Keshab Deuba, a public health epidemiologist, who is also a co-author of the report. “The report indicates that our health system is not prepared to handle a Covid-19 pandemic-like catastrophe and our progress could reverse at any time.”

The report shows that all-cause mortality rates declined between 1950 and 2019 and increased during the Covid pandemic period (2020–21) throughout the globe. In contrast with the overall reverse in mortality trends during the pandemic period, child mortality continued to decline.

“Global adult mortality rates markedly increased during the Covid-19 pandemic in 2020 and 2021, reversing past decreasing trends, while child mortality rates continued to decline, albeit more slowly than in earlier years,” reads the report.

Public health experts in Nepal said that continuation of routine vaccination, improvements in water and sanitation conditions, better nutrition and increased awareness can be credited for the decline in under-five mortality.

The Nepal Demographic and Health Survey-2022 carried out by the Ministry of Health and Population shows that under-five mortality rate has declined to 33 from 39 in 2016 and infant mortality rate to 28 from 32 in 2016, in every 1,000 live births.

The Lancet report estimated that 131 million people died globally from all causes in 2020 and 2021 combined, of which 15·9 million were due to the pandemic.

Deuba said excess mortality rates exceeded 1.5 deaths per 1,000 population during at least one year of the pandemic, which is higher than would be expected based on historical trends.

The Covid pandemic death toll includes fatalities that occurred directly due to SARS-CoV-2 infection and those caused indirectly due to other social, economic, or behavioural changes associated with the pandemic.

Excess mortality rates exceeded 150 deaths per 100,000 population during at least one year of the pandemic in 80 countries and territories, whereas 20 nations had a negative excess mortality rate in 2020 or 2021, indicating that all-cause mortality in these countries was lower during the pandemic than expected based on historical trends.

“Between 1950 and 2021, global life expectancy at birth increased by 22·7 years from 49 years to 71·7 years,” reads the report. “Global life expectancy at birth declined by 1·6 years between 2019 and 2021, reversing historical trends.”

An increase in life expectancy was only observed in 32 of 204 countries and territories between 2019 and 2021. The global population reached 7·89 billion in 2021, by which time 56 of 204 countries and territories had peaked and subsequently populations have declined.

In the meantime, India’s life expectancy at birth declined by only 1.8 years between 2019 and 2021, which is lower than Nepal.

Deuba said that the comprehensive demographic estimates reported in the report is expected to enable researchers, policymakers, health practitioners, and other key stakeholders to better understand and address profound changes that have occurred in the global health landscape following the first two years of the Covid pandemic, and longer-term trends beyond it.

“The lesson is that we should be well prepared and our health system should be resilient to deal with any adverse situations like the coronavirus pandemic,” said Deuba. “Otherwise, achievements we made over the years could reverse.”

title: Nepal working to protect investors, especially India, amid regime changes — envoy Shankar P. Sharma - ThePrint
description: Nepal working to protect investors, especially India, amid regime changes — envoy Shankar P. Sharma  ThePrint
publisher.title: ThePrint
full_article:
Sharma spoke to ThePrint on the sidelines of an industry outreach meeting hosted by the embassy of Nepal along with the Nepal Investment Summit and India’s PHD Chamber of Commerce and Industry Thursday.

During the meeting, Sharma highlighted that the tripartite agreement between India, Bangladesh and Nepal for the export of power from Kathmandu to Dhaka only required the “final signature”. He also said a bilateral investment agreement between Kathmandu and New Delhi “should be signed very soon”.

The outreach is a part of the government’s attempt to highlight the Himalayan country’s economic value to Indian investors. Sharma said that for Nepal, India was its largest investor, accounting for nearly a third of all foreign investment in the country.

“If we see historically, about one-third of our total investment is from India. That’s for several reasons – one is geographical proximity and the second is because our import and export is very high with India. Two-thirds of our total trade is with India,” Sharma told ThePrint.

The programme comes a month after Nepal’s prime minister Pushpa Kamal Dahal (Prachanda) broke a year-long coalition agreement with the Nepali Congress and formed a new one with former prime minister K.P. Oli’s party, the Communist Party of Nepal (Unified Marxist-Leninist).

Since Prachanda came to power at the end of 2022, his party has reforged coalitions with the CPN-UML and the NC, before returning to an alliance with the CPN-UML recently.

The new coalition has reported to be closing on formalising its Belt and Road Initiative implementation plan with China.

Also read: India, Nepal deepen ties with high-level talks

Nepal open for business

Sushil Bhatta, the chief executive officer of the Investment Bank of Nepal, said Nepal was open for business and highlighted sectors such as agro-processing, tourism, green energy and information technology as potential areas of Indian private investment.

“In the energy space, I am sure India requires clean and green energy. We have excellent bilateral exchange on the energy front… Where there is a market, the projects are viable. Investment also comes from where the market is,” Bhatta told ThePrint.

Bhatta said even with a government change, there was no shift in its policy priorities – an assurance that echoed the ambassador’s.

“We have always been getting a good amount of interest from India. The (Nepal) government has also been very pragmatically coming forward to host this event — a decision of the previous government,” Bhatta said.

He added this event was launched by the last government, and even if the government changes going forward, there will be continuity in “our priorities, our decisions and our agreements”.

(Edited by Tikli Basu)

title: Nepal's Mercenaries for Russia – DW – 04/13/2024 - DW (English)
description: Nepal's Mercenaries for Russia – DW – 04/13/2024  DW (English)
publisher.title: DW (English)
full_article:
Recruitment agencies smuggle young Nepalese men into the Ukraine war — they are supposed to fight for Putin's army. They are promised a good income and Russian citizenship.

But reality often looks different. Those who return complain about lack of payment and the terrible war routine. It's a life-threatening mission, many Nepalese are killed in the process. Yet, this doesn't deter some young Nepalese men, like 25-year-old Sonish, who is determined to go to Russia.

A report by Adil Bhat.
translated: भर्ती एजेंसी युवा नेपाली पुरुष क॑ यूक्रेन युद्ध म॑ तस्करी करै छै — ओकरा पुतिन केरऽ सेना लेली लड़ै के छै ।हुनका सब के नीक आमदनी आ रूसी नागरिकता के वादा कयल गेल अछि |मुदा यथार्थ प्रायः अलगे देखाइत अछि ।जे वापसी करैत छथि हुनका भुगतानक अभाव आ भयानक युद्धक दिनचर्याक शिकायत छनि ।ई जीवन केरऽ खतरा वाला मिशन छै, ई प्रक्रिया म॑ बहुत सारा नेपाली केरऽ हत्या होय जाय छै ।तइयो, एहि सं किछु युवा नेपाली पुरुष, जेना 25 वर्षीय सोनिश, जे रूस जेबाक लेल दृढ़ संकल्पित छथि, से नहिं रोकैत छथि.एडिल भाट द्वारा एक रिपोर्ट।

title: Nepal's Aviation Trailblazer: Simrik Air Launches "Helicopter Nepal" Magazine - yTech
description: Nepal's Aviation Trailblazer: Simrik Air Launches "Helicopter Nepal" Magazine  yTech
publisher.title: yTech
full_article:
In an insightful analysis of Nepal’s aviation sector, Simrik Air has embarked on a strategic initiative to enrich and promote helicopter tourism by unveiling its inaugural magazine titled “Helicopter Nepal”. This publication is set to serve as a cornerstone in broadcasting best practices, celebrating industry achievements, and solidifying Nepal’s stature as a top heli-tourism spot.

Helicopters serve as a crucial means of access to Nepal’s hard-to-reach destinations and a thrilling element for tourists seeking to experience the country’s majestic landscapes from above. “Helicopter Nepal” magazine fulfills a need for an informed platform that represents the array of views and experiences within the Nepalese helicopter community. Its comprehensive annual issues are expected to provide professional insight into industry trends, safety, economic challenges, and conversation on environmental impact.

As the global market for helicopter services accelerates, driven by technological advancements and a growing demand for emergency medical services, Nepal’s unique geographical appeal for aerial excursions places it in a prime position for growth. The new magazine’s debut is timely, aligning with market dynamics while aspiring to be a critical informational repository for those directly or indirectly involved with helicopters in Nepal.

With sustainability in mind, “Helicopter Nepal” not only reflects on the sector’s strides and hurdles but also commits to involving its stakeholders in discussions about preserving the natural environment alongside helicopter operations. Simrik Air’s pioneering effort with this magazine marks an essential step in supporting a more knowledge-driven and cohesive helicopter community in Nepal, paralleling the global discourse on industry growth through informed engagement and responsible practices.

In the context of broader industry commentary, the magazine is expected to act as a vital pulse on both regulatory challenges and technological innovations, guiding Nepal’s helicopter sector toward global competitiveness and excellence.

To stay updated on helicopter service trends and global insights, industry enthusiasts can consult leading websites such as Helicopter Association International or Vertical Magazine for professional resources and news. However, please verify the URLs before accessing these online resources.

Industry Overview

The helicopter tourism industry, particularly in regions like Nepal, plays a significant role in the overall aviation sector. Known for its rugged terrain and breath-taking scenery, Nepal has positioned itself as a premier destination for adventurers and tourists who wish to see the world’s highest peaks up close. Helicopters provide essential services in areas that are otherwise inaccessible due to the lack of road infrastructure or challenges of the terrain.

Market Forecasts

The global helicopter market is expected to experience steady growth over the next decade. Market research suggests that the demand for helicopter tourism will continue to rise, driven by increasing disposable income, a surge in tourism activities, and the quest for unique travel experiences. High-profile events, improved safety records, and the development of new routes in scenic areas contribute positively to the market outlook.

Industry Challenges

However, with growth comes the responsibility to address several challenges facing the helicopter tourism sector. These include concerns about the environmental impact, with noise and emissions affecting wildlife and the ecosystem. Safety is also paramount, with the need for enhanced pilot training, maintenance standards, and improved weather forecasting systems. Moreover, the regulatory environment requires careful navigation, ensuring compliance with local and international aviation laws and standards.

Operational costs for helicopter companies remain high, and this impacts pricing for consumers, potentially limiting market access. Economic fluctuations and geopolitical tensions can also affect tourism patterns and, by extension, the demand for helicopter services.

Environmental and Sustainability Issues

As the industry continues to expand, sustainability practices are becoming increasingly important. Companies like Simrik Air are engaging stakeholders in discussions on how to preserve the natural beauty of Nepal while still providing high-quality helicopter services. The potential for initiatives such as using lower-emission fuels, designing quieter rotor technologies, and implementing flight operations that minimize disruption to wildlife, are all topics that may be covered within “Helicopter Nepal” and the broader industry conversation.

Global Discourse and Opportunities

Nepal’s helicopter sector can benefit significantly from technological innovations, such as the exploitation of electric vertical take-off and landing (eVTOL) aircraft for reducing carbon footprints. There is also the possibility of adopting advanced air mobility systems that could re-shape accessibility in remote regions. Further, the expansion of emergency medical services and search and rescue operations using helicopters represents another growth area with a profound impact on society.

To aid in the knowledge and best practice sharing, industry operators and enthusiasts can visit globally recognized platforms such as the Helicopter Association International or the Vertical Magazine to stay informed about the latest industry developments, gaining insights into how to navigate the sector’s challenges and opportunities effectively. These resources can be invaluable in supporting Nepal’s helicopter community in achieving global competitiveness and operational excellence.

पता चलै छै कि हेलीकॉप्टर पर्यटन केरऽ मांग बढ़त॑ रहतै, जेकरा म॑ डिस्पोजेबल आय म॑ वृद्धि, पर्यटन गतिविधियऽ म॑ उछाल, आरू अद्वितीय यात्रा अनुभव के खोज होय क॑ संचालित होतै ।उच्च प्रोफाइल आयोजन, बेहतर सुरक्षा रिकॉर्ड, आरू मनोरम क्षेत्रऽ म॑ नया मार्गऽ के विकास बाजार केरऽ दृष्टिकोण म॑ सकारात्मक योगदान दै छै ।उद्योग चुनौती हालांकि, विकास के जिम्मेदारी छै हेलीकॉप्टर पर्यटन क्षेत्र के सामने आबै वाला कई चुनौती के संबोधित करै के.अइ मे पर्यावरणीय प्रभाव कें बारे मे चिंता शामिल छै, जइ मे शोर आ उत्सर्जन वन्यजीव आ पारिस्थितिकी तंत्र कें प्रभावित करएयत छै.सुरक्षा भी सर्वोपरि छै, जेकरा म॑ पायलट प्रशिक्षण, रखरखाव के मानक, आरू बेहतर मौसम पूर्वानुमान प्रणाली के जरूरत छै.एतबे नहि, नियामक वातावरण मे सावधानीपूर्वक नेविगेशन कें आवश्यकता छै, जे स्थानीय आ अंतर्राष्ट्रीय विमानन कानून आ मानक कें अनुपालन सुनिश्चित करय छै.हेलीकॉप्टर कंपनीक कें लेल परिचालन लागत बेसि रहयत छै, आ इ उपभोक्ताअक कें लेल मूल्य निर्धारण कें प्रभावित करयत छै, जे संभावित रूप सं बाजार कें पहुंच कें सीमित करयत छै.आर्थिक उतार-चढ़ाव आरू भू-राजनीतिक तनाव पर्यटन पैटर्न आरू विस्तार स॑ हेलीकॉप्टर सेवा केरऽ मांग क॑ भी प्रभावित करी सकै छै ।पर्यावरण आ स्थायित्व मुद्दा जेना-जेना उद्योग कें विस्तार जारी होयत छै, स्थायित्व प्रथाक कें महत्व बढ़ी रहल छै.सिमरिक एयर जैसनऽ कंपनी न॑ नेपाल केरऽ प्राकृतिक सौंदर्य क॑ कोना संरक्षित करलऽ जाय, एकरा लेली चर्चा म॑ हितधारकऽ क॑ शामिल करी रहलऽ छै जबकि अभी भी उच्च गुणवत्ता वाला हेलीकॉप्टर सेवा प्रदान करै छै ।निम्न उत्सर्जन ईंधन के उपयोग, शांत रोटर प्रौद्योगिकी के डिजाइन, आरू वन्यजीवऽ म॑ व्यवधान क॑ कम स॑ कम करै वाला उड़ान परिचालन क॑ लागू करै के पहल के संभावना, ई सब विषय छै जेकरा “हेलीकॉप्टर नेपाल” आरू व्यापक उद्योग के बातचीत के भीतर कवर करलऽ जाय सकै छै ।वैश्विक प्रवचन आरू अवसर नेपाल केरऽ हेलीकॉप्टर क्षेत्र क॑ तकनीकी नवाचारो स॑ काफी फायदा मिल॑ सकै छै, जेना कि कार्बन पदचिह्न क॑ कम करै लेली इलेक्ट्रिक ऊर्ध्वाधर टेक-ऑफ आरू लैंडिंग (ईवीटीओएल) विमान केरऽ शोषण ।उन्नत वायु गतिशीलता प्रणाली कें अपनावय कें संभावना सेहो छै जे दूरस्थ क्षेत्रक मे सुलभता कें पुनः आकार द सकय छै.आरू, हेलीकॉप्टर के उपयोग करी क॑ आपातकालीन चिकित्सा सेवा आरू खोज आरू बचाव परिचालन के विस्तार समाज प॑ गहन प्रभाव के साथ एगो आरू विकास क्षेत्र के प्रतिनिधित्व करै छै ।ज्ञान आरू सर्वोत्तम अभ्यास साझा करै म॑ सहायता करै लेली, उद्योग संचालक आरू उत्साही हेलीकॉप्टर एसोसिएशन इंटरनेशनल या ऊर्ध्वाधर पत्रिका जैसनऽ वैश्विक स्तर प॑ मान्यता प्राप्त प्लेटफॉर्मऽ प॑ जाय सकै छै ताकि नवीनतम उद्योग विकास के बारे म॑ सूचित रह॑ सक॑, जेकरा स॑ ई क्षेत्र केरऽ चुनौती आरू अवसरऽ के प्रभावी ढंग स॑ कोना नेविगेट करलऽ जाय, ई बात के जानकारी प्राप्त करलऽ जाय सक॑ । के .वैश्विक प्रतिस्पर्धा आ परिचालन उत्कृष्टता प्राप्त करय मे नेपाल कें हेलीकॉप्टर समुदाय title: Nepal's Dipendra Singh Airee Smashes 6 Sixes in an Over, Joins Yuvraj & Pollard - The Quint
description: Nepal's Dipendra Singh Airee Smashes 6 Sixes in an Over, Joins Yuvraj & Pollard  The Quint
publisher.title: The Quint
full_article:
Nepal batter Dipendra Singh Airee smashed six sixes in an over during his team’s match against Qatar at the ACC Men’s Premier Cup, in Oman’s Al Amarat on Saturday (13 April). With this feat, he became only the third batter to hit six consecutive sixes in an over in a men’s T20I match, joining Yuvraj Singh and Kieron Pollard on the elite list.

Nepal, who will be featuring in this year’s T20 World Cup, are currently competing at the ACC Men’s Premier Cup, where they won their first match against Malaysia. In their second match, they are facing Qatar.

title: Nepal star makes history with six sixes in an over - ICC Cricket
description: Nepal star makes history with six sixes in an over  ICC Cricket
publisher.title: ICC Cricket
full_article:
Airee was on 28 off 15 balls before the start of the final over of the innings against Kamran Khan. He went on to hit every ball of the last over for six to finish on 64 off 21 balls.

The Nepal star player came through the 2016 ICC Men's U19 Cricket World Cup in 2016 and got into the senior team by the age of 17.

Interestingly, last year, Airee hit six consecutive sixes in the Asian Games against Mongolia, but then the feat was spread across two overs when he smashed the fastest fifty in T20Is in nine balls, breaking Yuvraj Singh's record of 12 deliveries.

Airee's form is a huge boost for Nepal with less than 50 days to go for the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2024. Nepal are in Group D alongside South Africa, Sri Lanka, Bangladesh and the Netherlands in the marquee tournament, hosted in the Caribbean Islands and USA.

title: Janakpurdham Cultural Festival celebrates Nepali New Year with music and food - Myrepublica
description: Janakpurdham Cultural Festival celebrates Nepali New Year with music and food  Myrepublica
publisher.title: Myrepublica
full_article:
KATHMANDU, April 13: The 2nd edition of the Janakpurdham Cultural Festival was held on April 13, 2024, coinciding with the Nepali New Year 2081 BS. Organized by the Swami Vivekananda Cultural Centre (SVCC), Embassy of India in Kathmandu, in collaboration with the Consulate General of India, Birgunj, and the BP Koirala India-Nepal Foundation, the festival took place at the Mahendranarayan Nidhi Mithila Cultural Center in Janakpur.

The festival featured two sessions, starting with a keynote address on ‘Jaanaki Lila’ by Haribans Jha, exhibitions on sarees and the forts of India and Nepal, and a Maithili Food Festival curated by chef Santosh Sah. The evening session included musical performances based on the life of Lord Ram and Sita, and a special performance by Nepali singer and Indian Idol 2024 top 10 contestant, Menuka Poudel.

The event was inaugurated by Saroj Kumar Yadav, Chief Minister of Madhesh Province, with Manoj Kumar Sah, Mayor of Janakpurdham Sub-Metropolitan City, serving as the chief guest for the evening. The festival was attended by Provincial Assembly members of Madhesh Province, dignitaries, the media, and a large audience, celebrating the shared cultural heritage of India and Nepal.

title: Nepal batter Dipendra Singh Airee hits six sixes in an over; becomes third player to achieve feat in T20Is - WION
description: Nepal batter Dipendra Singh Airee hits six sixes in an over; becomes third player to achieve feat in T20Is  WION
publisher.title: WION
full_article:
Nepal's Dipendra Singh Airee has created history by becoming the third player to hit six sixes in an over of an international T20I. The Nepal batter reached the feat against Qatar on April 13 in Asian Cricket Council (ACC) Men's Premier Cup match. Airee reached the milestone in 20th over of Nepal's innings against Qatar's Kamran Khan.

Airee, who was at 28 off 15 before the start of the final over, eventually finished with 21-ball 64 as Nepal posted 210/7 in 20 overs. He now has entered the list with India's Yuvraj Singh and West Indies' Kieron Pollard, who also have hit six sixes in an over in a T20I.

Yuvraj had hit England's Stuart Broad for six sixes during the inaugural T20 World Cup in 2007 while Pollard had smashed Sri Lanka's Akila Dananjaya in 2021. Overall, Airee is the fifth player to hit six sixes in an over in an international match.

Apart from the above three, South Africa's Herschelle Gibbs and the USA's Jaskaran Malhotra have also achieved the feat, albeit in ODIs.

Airee is not new to making records, he had also hit the fastest fifty in T20Is last year during the Asian Games as well. Batting against Mongolia, Airee scored 52 not out off just 9 balls - the minimum required to hit a fifty. He had hit six sixes in a row in that match as well, but they were spread across two overs. Nepal had also posted a record 314/3 - the first 300-plus total in T20Is.

As for the match against Qatar, Nepal restricted the opposition for 178/9 and won the match by 32 runs. For Qatar, skipper Muhammad Tanveer top scored with 33-ball 63.

title: Airee makes history as Nepal register second Premier Cup victory - The Kathmandu Post
description: Airee makes history as Nepal register second Premier Cup victory  The Kathmandu Post

full_article:
Nepal registered their second win in the ongoing 2024 ACC Men’s Premier Cup after defeating Qatar by 32 runs at the Al Amerat Cricket Ground in Al Amerat, Oman on Saturday.



Opting to bat first, the Rhinos had accumulated a total of 210 runs as Dipendra Singh Airee posted an unbeaten half-century, which featured a record six maximums in a single over.

In reply, the defending champions limited Qatar to 178 in the stipulated 20 overs.

Earlier, Nepal were off to a slow start losing opener Kushal Bhurtel for a cheap 11-ball 12 after Qatar’s Amar Farooq had him caught by Kamran Khan in 2.5 overs.

Captain Rohit Paudel was next to go, being caught by Muhammad Tanveer off Himanshu Rathod. Paudel faced 17 deliveries and contributed 18 runs.

Another opener and wicketkeeper Aasif Sheikh and Kushal Malla brought a 53-run partnership before Malla was dismissed in 13.5 overs. He smashed two hits to the fences and three maximums, scoring 35 runs in his 18-knock play.

Sheikh cracked a half-century to contribute 52 off 41 balls before being caught by Muhammad Tanveer off Himanshu Rathod in 14.2 overs.

Airee demonstrated a remarkable batting show as he put an unbeaten 64 runs on the scoreboard. The half-century featured three hits to the fences and seven maximums, of which six were fired in just the final over of the innings.

In doing so, Airee became the first Nepali player to ever achieve the rare feat.

He joined Yuvraj Singh of India and Kieron Pollard of West Indies to become the third batter to achieve the feat in Men's T20Is.

Qatar lost wickets in quick succession as most batters failed to score in double digits.

Opener Saqlain Arshad was dismissed for a single run in just the third delivery of the innings while Mohammad Ahnaff was also caught for an 18-ball 23 in 4.6 overs.

Another opener Kamran Khan was next to go, being bowled out by Gulshan Jha for 18 runs.

Qatar captain Muhammad Tanveer brought some stability to innings as he put 63 runs in 33 deliveries. Tanveer muscled six hits to the fences and four maximums.

Himanshu Rathod (22*) and Mirza Adnan Ali (19) were the only other batters to post double-digit scores for Qatar.

For Nepal, Dipendra Singh Airee, Lalit Narayan Rajbanshi, and Gulshan Jha claimed three wickets each while Kushal Malla and Abinash Bohara also took a wicket apiece.

Nepal began their 2025 Asia Cup campaign with a hard-fought five-wicket victory over Malaysia in their opening match of the series at the Al Amerat Cricket Ground in Al Amerat, Oman on Friday.

Chasing 144, the defending champions Nepal achieved the target in 19.2 overs losing five wickets, but had to survive some scare from the Malaysians late in the innings.

title: Dipendra Singh Airee of Nepal matches Yuvraj Singh and Pollard Kieron with six sixes in an over - Hindustan Times
description: Dipendra Singh Airee of Nepal matches Yuvraj Singh and Pollard Kieron with six sixes in an over  Hindustan Times
publisher.title: Hindustan Times
full_article:
Nepal batsman Dipendra Singh Airee became just the third man to hit six sixes in one over in an international T20 match when he achieved the feat against Qatar in Al Amerat on Saturday. Dipendra Singh Airee

He joins India's Yuvraj Singh, who made his runs off England's Stuart Broad in Durban in the 2007 World Cup, and West Indies all-rounder Kieron Pollard who hammered Sri Lanka's Akila Dananjaya in Antigua in 2021.

Unlock exclusive access to the story of India's general elections, only on the HT App. Download Now!

South Africa's Herschelle Gibbs and USA's Jaskaran Malhotra have achieved the feat in one-day international cricket while no one has ever done it in Test cricket.

Airee was on 28 from 15 balls, and Nepal on 174 for 7, when medium pacer Kamran Khan began the final over of the innings in the ACC Men's Premier Cup match.

The next six deliveries were all deposited over the ropes as Airee finished on 64 not out from 21 balls.

Nepal, who will appear in their second T20 World Cup later this year in West Indies and USA, closed on 210 for 7 which was enough to beat Qatar by 32 runs.

It was the second time that Airee, 24, has hit six successive sixes.

He achieved it against Mongolia in their Asian Games meeting in Hangzhou in September, but on that occassion the six sixes were spread across two overs.

Nepal begin their T20 World Cup against the Netherlands in Dallas on June 4. They will also play group games against South Africa, Sri Lanka and Bangladesh.

title: Nepal govt allows nighttime business in tourist capital Thamel - ThePrint
description: Nepal govt allows nighttime business in tourist capital Thamel  ThePrint
publisher.title: ThePrint
full_article:
“From the administrative point of view, the guarantee about security, management in the area, no stone would be left unturned. Every person who-so-ever comes here, be it Nepali or foreigner, everyone is equal and safe; Government of Nepal bears the responsibility for it as well as the Home Ministry and the Nepal Police,” Rabi Lamichhane, the Home Minister of the Himalayan Nation, said this while addressing the event.

Thamel, the touristy destination of Nepal, earlier had restrictions on operation of

businesses.

As per the December 2022 decision, the liquor shops were allowed to stay open till 10 PM, Restaurants till midnight and dance bars and clubs to operate till 4 AM. From Saturday it would now be open round the clock.

The tourist hotspot is also famous and is thronged by young generations as well as those wanting recreation, as it offers various services relating to food, entertainment and gatherings. With the tourist centre operating 24/7, locals and businesses here are expecting a boom.

“We are extremely happy with the decision of government. Tourists from various country who come here are now being provided with facilities of lodging and food round the clock by this decision of government, it is welcoming. The businesses will also flourish and it is spreading out positive message all across,” Resham Giri, a business owner in Thamel, told ANI.

From Saturday, Thamel, which earlier had been synonymous to nightlife, had been it’s

identity but it used to go to sleep before mid-night. As businesses pull down

their shutter by 10 PM, spell of silence was used to cast over Thamel. Local authority had

citied security reasons to close down the business as the national capital of Nepal

starts to slumber past 7 PM in the evening.

Thamel also faced a clampdown on operating its nightlife because of the insurgency, which grappled the Himalayan nation for over a decade, starting from 1996 to 2006. Chained by regulations since then, Thamel started to take a breath since the end of 2022, when selected businesses got permission to run late.

Saturday’s move also comes with some restrictions and a set of ethics to be followed by the business as well as the visitors, which limits the volume of music, driving, amongst others.

As per the Thamel Area Development Committee, the 24/7 module of operation in Thamel is estimated to create 25,000 additional jobs in addition to the 50,000 employed ones as of now. Authorities also have installed 111 CCTV Cameras for video surveillance in Thamel to ensure security for about 9,500 businesses and 2,700 property owners in the area, which don’t seem to be enough.

“This planning and execution are good about opening the Thamel round the clock/24 hours. This would encourage tourists to engage here not only for just 12 hours, but for another 12 hours to enjoy here as we have multiple bars, restaurants around here. They would expend in those places,” Lakpa Sherpa, a Nepali visitor who came to Thamel to celebrate the Nepali New Year, told ANI.

Tourism contributes about 2.1 percent of the national GDP of Nepal, as per the 2022 data released by the annual World Travel and Tourism Council research report.

The total contribution of travel and tourism to the GDP –including wider effects from investment, the supply chain and induced income impacts–was Rs 297 billion in 2022 (or 6.1 percent of the GDP).

This primarily reflects the economic activity generated by sectors such as hotels, travel agents, airlines and other passenger transport services (excluding commuter services).

The report said that travel and tourism generated 311,125 jobs directly in 2022 (1.9 per cent of the total). This includes employment by hotels, travel agents, and leisure industries directly supported by tourists. In total, 1.08 million jobs were directly or indirectly created. (ANI)
